text: I'm not afraid to say that I liked this game and searched perfection in my photos.
author: El Jugador Escaldenc

text: I remember getting this game for my birthday, probably in 1999 or 2000. Beat if before the day was over but what a blast I had. I used to be such a big Pokémon-fan before they expanded the franchise with new generations. I can only agree with Supra: It was truly magical to suddenly see Pokémon in 3D and with so many ways to interact with them.
author: Marcus Mührmann-Lund

text: who knew taking pictures of pokemon could be so fun?
author: Green Beats

text: Still waiting for a sequel. Lol. I had a lot of great memories with this game, and I like this piece a lot.
author: Joshua Fagan

text: I still have my stickers I printed at Blockbuster.
author: daneofurexistence

text: The game was pretty intriguing with the different levels you could visit and the integration of interaction to find/evolve pokemon during a visit. I think i got all of them back then...
author: SwissCheesy_ez

text: I love the Pokemon Snap ost, such a sham that not of lot people go and listen to the ost.
author: Darknile

text: Also don't forget the Magikarp that turns into a Gyarados in the waterfall!
author: Darknile

text: Snap has a suprisenly good soundtrack for what it is.
author: Darek Link

text: This game was such a marvel. Going from that flat 2d sprite on the Game Boy up to the 3d models was almost incomprehensible at the time of its release...
author: KidDivinegon

text: So many great memories of playing this game back then, I would play with friends during lunch hour at school thanks to the nearby games store that would let you play any game there for 5$/hour. The concept was very simple but seeing all these pokemon in 3D, safari-style, almost felt magical to us huge fans of the gameboy game. Good times!
author: SupraDarky

text: I hope they expand the Pokéfinder idea in the full release of Sun & Moon.
author: Alfonso ST
